title: Ichchha Raj Tamang and Civil Cooperative Fraud and Money Laundering Case
description:
A large-scale financial fraud and money laundering case involving Ichchha Raj Tamang, a former Member of Parliament and founder of the Civil Group, who served as the chairman of Civil Savings and Credit Cooperative Society Limited. Tamang is accused of embezzling billions of rupees from the cooperative's depositors by illegally diverting funds to his personal real estate ventures, primarily under the 'Civil Homes' brand.

Investigations by the Central Investigation Bureau (CIB) of Nepal Police, initiated after complaints from over 1,500 victims, revealed that Tamang channeled approximately 90% of the cooperative's deposits into his own companies, a direct violation of Nepal's Cooperative Act. The cooperative allegedly lured depositors with unusually high interest rates (reportedly up to 17%) and other incentives like gold coins.

A downturn in the real estate market led to a severe liquidity crisis within the cooperative, preventing thousands of depositors from withdrawing their savings. This led to two major legal actions:

  1. A fraud and organized crime case filed at the Kathmandu District Court against 42 individuals, seeking to recover NPR 5.67 billion. This case is currently ongoing.
  2. A money laundering case filed by the Department of Money Laundering Investigation (DMLI) at the Special Court against Tamang and five family members, alleging they laundered embezzled funds.

On January 21, 2024, the Special Court convicted Ichchha Raj Tamang, his wife Srijana Shakya Tamang, and his associate Keshav Lal Shrestha of money laundering. The court handed down prison sentences, substantial fines, and ordered the confiscation of illegally amassed assets.
unverified_info: Initial reports from August 2021 suggested that the total amount of embezzlement being investigated by the Central Investigation Bureau (CIB) was over Rs 8 billion. While the formal court filings later specified a claimed amount of Rs 5.67 billion in the fraud case, the initial higher estimate indicates the potential scale of the fraud may have been larger than what was formally prosecuted based on the available victim complaints.
key_allegations: Embezzlement of depositor funds from a cooperative
Illegal diversion of cooperative funds to private real estate companies
Money laundering to legitimize illicitly obtained funds
alleged_entities: Civil Savings and Credit Cooperative Society Limited

timeline.title: CIB Investigation Begins
timeline.description: The Central Investigation Bureau (CIB) of Nepal Police started an investigation into allegations of embezzlement of over Rs 8 billion at Civil Cooperative.

timeline.title: Ichchha Raj Tamang Arrested
timeline.description: CIB arrested Ichchha Raj Tamang and 11 other officials from the cooperative on charges of fraud and misappropriation of funds.

timeline.title: Fraud and Organized Crime Case Filed
timeline.description: The District Attorney Office, Kathmandu, filed a case at the Kathmandu District Court against 42 individuals, including Tamang, with a claimed amount of Rs 5.67 billion.

timeline.title: Court Orders Pre-trial Detention
timeline.description: The Kathmandu District Court ordered Ichchha Raj Tamang and Keshav Lal Shrestha to be sent to jail for pre-trial detention.

timeline.title: Srijana Shakya Tamang Arrested
timeline.description: Srijana Shakya Tamang, wife of Ichchha Raj Tamang and a member of the cooperative's audit committee, was arrested by the CIB after being on the run.

timeline.title: Srijana Shakya Tamang Sent to Jail
timeline.description: Following a court order, Srijana Shakya Tamang was sent to jail for pre-trial detention.

timeline.title: Money Laundering Case Filed
timeline.description: The Department of Money Laundering Investigation (DMLI) filed a separate case at the Special Court against Tamang and five family members for laundering illicit funds.

timeline.title: Conviction in Money Laundering Case
timeline.description: The Special Court convicted Ichchha Raj Tamang, Srijana Shakya Tamang, and Keshav Lal Shrestha of money laundering. Tamang's two daughters were acquitted.

timeline.title: Sentencing in Money Laundering Case
timeline.description: The Special Court announced the verdict: 3 years jail for Ichchha Raj Tamang, 1.5 years for Srijana Shakya Tamang, and 1.5 years for Keshav Lal Shrestha, along with substantial fines and asset confiscation.

sources.description: Setopati report detailing the final sentences, including jail terms and specific fine amounts, for Ichchha Raj Tamang, Srijana Shakya, and Keshav Lal Shrestha, as decided by the Special Court.
